content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(words, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 <= text_width
            # Add the word to the current line
            current_line *= " $word"
        else
            # Push the current line to the lines array
            push!(lines, current_line)
            
            # Start a new line with the current word
            current_line = "$word"
        end
    end
    
    # Push the last current line to the lines array
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    return join(lines, '\n')
end
```

Example:
```julia
words = split("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog")
wrapped_text = wrap_string(words)
println(wrapped_text)
```

Output:
```
The quick brown fox jumps 
over the lazy dog
```
